title: Split the solution in multiple projects
author: xas
body_snippet:
Related to #308

I think the current state of code is a little complex, and difficult to maintain because of its monolith structure

It would be interesting to start to isolate some part of the code and extract it to multiple dotnet core library projects and be able to get only a front project, platform dependent.

## Expected Behavior

Each library could target `netstandard2.0;net6.0;net7.0;...`

With this configuration, any team could develop a frontend more easily in any dotnet fram...

comments.author: sovamind
comments.snippet: This would also support having SSH directly integrated into the application. Having a separate instance of PuTTY installed isn't a great way to handle SSH for a console application that is supposed to be a single app for all consoles. I've got many places where they use PuTTY and it causes tons of confusion about which PuTTY they need to add saved sessions or which PuTTY agent they need to run for unlocking their keyfiles.
